formattedAddress: 15 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: Nice, clean, well maintained store located in a very busy street. They sell meat, diary products, snacks, beer and many more. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They sell a lot basic kitchen amenities. They are priced reasonably.

text.text: Nice, clean, well maintained store located in a very busy street. They sell meat, diary products, snacks, beer and many more. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They sell a lot basic kitchen amenities. They are priced reasonably.

originalText.text:
MORTON WILLIAMS LEAVES CUSTOMERS OUT IN THE COLD
Apparently shoplifting is on the rise.Â  Nonetheless, I am tired of being inconvenienced because of other peoples' misbehaviors.Â  Merchants would rather lock up their products and lock their doors than hire security.

Morton Williams has decided to shut down the registers and lock the doors at the "Freedom" Place entrance at night to prevent shoplifters from exiting the store with groceries.

They are aware that, especially during the winter months, law abiding customers find it annoying to be locked out of the store and made to walk around the block to the other entrance, and then walk around again in the freezing cold carrying bags full of groceries.

They have been reminded them that a significant percentage of their business now comes from Waterline Square residents and others on the westside and that locking us out is not the answer to their shoplifting problems.

Keeping the Freedom Place doors open until store closing is a small request made in the interest of Customer Service and would only require Morton Williams to extend the security shift at the Freedom place entrance by 2 hours!

So Morton Williams ,Â  be kind and be smart, because IÂ  am certain thatÂ  the cost of fixing this problem will be significantly less then the cost of losing business from a growing number of disgruntled customers.

originalText.text: This has been my go-to store for 5 years. Staff and selection has always been amazing. However on my last visit a new security guy named Guillermo followed me around and kept walking past me while I was shopping for an item in the baking section ðŸ¤” Seriously?!?!?!?! That was excessive and uncomfortable as heck. I spoke to the female manager on duty about it but I don't think people understand how unwarranted and unnecessary that was. I live upstairs across the street, it's easy to run down and a grab what I need but after that harassment I'm rethinking my options on where to go for my food and beverages

originalText.text: I came in for a salad today, the service was wonderful, the ingredients looked fresh, but unfortunately when I got back to the office, the salad was full of sand :( As someone who buys cilantro regularly, I assume that was the culprit as it requires very thorough washing. Very disappointed at money wasted and no time to go out again.

originalText.text: Prices are astronomical and due to the huge amount of stock products are very often well passed their use by date - sometimes by 6+ months! Make sure you check before buying as they clearly donâ€™t.
